boat.name: Periwinkle

owners.note: Periwinkle was purchased from Simon Dutton, a former OGA member, in February 2008.  Simon owned her for about five years.  She had only one previous owner who was the original purchaser.  Unfortunately there is no record of his name or of her sailing history with him.
owners.text: Periwinkle was purchased from Simon Dutton, a former OGA member, in February

boat.full_description:
Periwinkle's design was based on an early 19th century fishing boat from the Itchen Ferry yards on the Hamble. She was rigged as a gaff cutter with a pole masted topsail. 

'Periwinkle' was built by Glyn White of Fowey,  was a former cabinet maker who built a number of Tamarisks at his yard in Fowey. One of his former workers recognised 'Periwinkle' whilst recently moored in Fowey and told her owner about her origins and the small yard beside the water where she was built.  The yard is no longer being now replaced by houses.

She appears to have spent most of her time in the River Dart area being moored latterly in Dartmouth and is thought to have just been used for cruising along the South West coasts.  But her full sailing history is not known.
boat.short_description: 'Periwinkle' is a Tamarisk 24 designed by David Cannel and built by Glyn White of Fowey in 1983. Glyn was a former cabinet maker and thus not surprisingly she was finished to a high standard. The hull was made in GRP and the deck in marine ply, the rest in teak and iroko.
